title: Sapugaskanda active after receiving fuel, 108 MW added to the grid
content: The Sapugaskanda A and B power plants, which were previously inactivated owing to the fuel shortage, have been reactivated. CEB spokesman Andrew Navamani stated that the Sapugaskanda power plant was reactivated after receiving fuel at midnight last night (18). Accordingly, the capacity of the Sapugaskanda power plant to be added to the national grid is 108 MW CEB spokesman Andrew Navamuni added that todayâ€™s decision to cut power would be based on the amount of fuel supplied to power plants.
